thread.title: UPDATE: Elderly couple cut free and rushed to hospital after road crash
thread.title_full: UPDATE: Elderly couple cut free and rushed to hospital after road crash

title: UPDATE: Elderly couple cut free and rushed to hospital after road crash
text:
1 comment 
AN ELDERLY couple had to be cut from their car, following a head-on crash this morning. 
The incident, which occurred on Warsash Road near Locks Heath at 10.45am, involved a green Subaru Estate and a black Ford Focus. 
The Subaru had to have its roof cut off to free the couple. 
The driver of the Ford, an elderly man, has been taken to Queen Alexandra Hospital, while the couple were admitted to Southampton General. Share article 
Their injuries are not thought to be life threatening. 
Five fire engines and an air ambulance were called to the scene, with the vehicles recovered before the road was reopened around 2pm. Promoted Stories Elderly couple cut free after road crash in Locks Heath   Hector2004 5:07pm Wed 16 Sep 15 
Five fire engines !! Clearly the current weather has dampened the potential for fire and in doing so, sucked the excitement out of the job ! p.s. best wishes for a speedy recovery.
